revised_title: Experimental Researches on the Strength of Pillars of Cast Iron: Investigating the Factors Affecting Strength and Design
tldr: Eaton Hodgkinson's experiments on cast iron pillars reveal the effects of pillar shape, iron type, and length on their breaking weight. He also investigates the differences in crushing strength between the center and outer parts of the pillars, leading to adjustments in the formulae for calculating their strength.
